intro: Draba reptans subsp. stellifera, commonly known as the starflower, is a low-growing flowering plant native to rocky and alpine environments in Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are basal, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Draba reptans subsp. stellifera is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
